content: note i also have a video tutorial on the squares that you can access here www youtube com/watch v=jfqy-xugry8 the phase spiral blanket was inspired by the phase spirals in the milky way discovered by antoja and colleagues in 2018 using the gaia telescope since their discovery they ve been a hot topic in galactic dynamics with many papers being dedicated to plotting grids of these spirals using various colours the spirals in this blanket are made as individual squares working 2 colors at a time these are then all joined up with slip stitches or however you prefer to join them and decorated with a simple half_double_crochet border using the remaining yarn this blanket has a lot of customisability you can choose any stitch for the border switch up the colours or amount of colours and of course the size since the blanket has a modular construction you can make it as big/small as you want a guide on how many squares are needed for a single/double/queen blanket will be given the pictured blanket measures 100/150 cm using 11 x 15 squares you can use any yarn and gauge you want and play around with how many squares you need the spirals in the pictured blanket used a 3 5mm crochet hook and 4 ply yarn with the squares ending up being 9cm in width use this as a gauge if you want to follow my blanket sizing the spiral squares take about 15-20 minutes to make the yarn requirements are for single double queen 1 2 2 x cotton kings 500g cotton cone in black 09 1 2 3 x 50g hobbii friends cotton 8/4 print in 9 different colours listed below some colors have been discontinued since my purchase of these yarns so below are the alternative colorways as of 2025 03 - strawberry love red 02 - sea buckthorn orange 01 - summer sunrise yellow 12 - jungle green green 10 - fresh mint turquoise 09 - tropical ocean blue 07 - lavender potpourri purple 34 - violets violet 06 - raspberry sorbet pink each square uses very little yarn so this could be an ideal scrap yarn project the pattern includes the total squares required and squares per colour so if you do end up changing the amount of colours you use just follow the total count happy crocheting
